macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Dow Hits New Record Close Above 50,000 Amid Flat Session
items.summary: The Dow Jones rose 0.10% to a record 50,188.14 on February 10, while Nasdaq fell 0.59% and S&P 500 treaded water after unchanged December retail sales data. Markets showed low volatility with mean-reversion ahead of key NFP jobs report expected below 100K.

items.title: Retail Sales Unchanged, Raising Doubts Ahead of NFP
items.summary: U.S. retail sales were flat in December, contributing to a calm, low-volatility session as traders position for Thursday's crucial nonfarm payrolls release with consensus at 70K and below 100K expected. A weak print could accelerate rate cut pricing, while a strong beat above 140K would reduce it.

items.title: Spotify Surges 15.5% on Strong Earnings; S&P Global Drops 7%
items.summary: Spotify led earnings reactions with a 15.5% gain after strong results, joined by double-digit moves in DataDog, while S&P Global fell 7% on weak guidance and Xylem dropped 9%. Coca-Cola dipped 2% despite in-line forecasts, with AstraZeneca highlighting weight-loss drug plans.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Drops 3% to $66,000 Amid Bearish Momentum
items.summary: Bitcoin fell nearly 3% on February 11, 2026, testing $66,000 and breaking below the 200-week EMA at $68,000 for the first time since the recent rally, with analysts warning of weak buyer momentum to reclaim $69,000.[1][2]

items.title: Ethereum Declines 3.5% to $1,950, Downside Breakout Anticipated
items.summary: Ethereum dropped 3.5% to $1,950, remaining trapped in a consolidation range with resistance at $2,100 and support at $1,800; analysts expect a bearish breakout toward $1,400 or even $1,000.[1]

items.title: XRP and Dogecoin Follow Broader Crypto Sell-Off
items.summary: XRP fell 2% to $1.37 and Dogecoin dropped 3% to $0.09, marking the fifth down session for DOGE, as cryptocurrencies declined for the third straight day.[1]

items.title: Bears in Control of Bitcoin Market per Daily Chart Analysis
items.summary: Bitcoin futures weakened on February 11, 2026, with bears dominating amid a persistent downtrend, pausing after recent volatility.[3]

items.title: Layer Z0 Announces Layer 1 Blockchain with 2M TPS
items.summary: Layer Z0 revealed its own Layer 1 blockchain leveraging Layer 0 infrastructure, promising up to 2 million transactions per second, in partnership with Ark Invest and Cathie Wood.[4]

items.title: US Banks and White House Meeting Impact Crypto Prices
items.summary: A White House meeting between crypto sector and banks yesterday contributed to Bitcoin's decline today, amid broader market weakness linked to US unemployment and inflation data.[4]

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: New AI Sensor 'Sniffs' Out Spectral Targets
items.summary: Berkeley Lab has developed a first-of-its-kind AI-enhanced sensor that can identify target objects in real-time by analyzing spectral images. The sensor improves speed, resolution, and power efficiency of existing spectral machine vision technologies by more than two orders of magnitude.

items.title: Red Hat Unifies AI and Tactical Edge Deployment for UK MOD
items.summary: The UK Ministry of Defence has selected Red Hat to architect a unified AI and hybrid cloud backbone across its entire estate, marking a significant enterprise AI deployment.

items.title: Chinese AI Models Dominating Open-Source as Western Labs Step Back
items.summary: Chinese AI models like Qwen2 now dominate 175,000 exposed systems globally as Western labs face regulatory pressure, revealing a shift in open-source AI development landscape.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Intrepid Studios Shuts Down, Halting Ashes of Creation Development
items.summary: Ashes of Creation developer Intrepid Studios has shut down, marking a significant setback for the long-in-development MMORPG. The closure was reported on February 10, 2026.

items.title: Krafton Reports Record Annual Revenue and Teases AI for Humanoid Robots
items.summary: Krafton announced record annual revenue on February 10, 2026, while highlighting its AI technology's potential to develop humanoid robots. The company continues to expand in gaming and emerging tech.

items.title: Control Surpasses 5 Million Sales and 20 Million Players Milestone
items.summary: Remedy's Control has achieved over 5 million sales and attracted 20 million players total, as revealed on February 10, 2026. The studio also appointed a former EA executive as new CEO.

items.title: Sony Confirms State of Play for February 12, 2026 with Potential Big Reveals
items.summary: PlayStation has officially confirmed a State of Play event on February 12, 2026, with expectations for game announcements including possible Capcom titles and PlayStation Plus updates. Rumors suggest Devil May Cry 6 reveal.

items.title: Subnautica 2 Tops Steam Wishlists for 2026 with 3.8 Million
items.summary: Subnautica 2 leads 2026 Steam wishlists with 3.8 million, followed by Forza Horizon 6 at 2.6 million. The survival game is highly anticipated among upcoming releases.

items.title: Marathon Reveals Release Date, Pricing, Voice Cast, and System Requirements
items.summary: Bungie's extraction shooter Marathon announced its release date, pricing, stacked voice cast, and recommended PC requirements in updates from the past day. Sales on Steam surged post-reveal.

items.title: Türkiye Development Fund Invests in Mobile Developer Ace Games
items.summary: Türkiye's Development Fund invested in Istanbul-based Ace Games through its Technology and Innovation Fund, supporting mobile game development. This marks a new gaming-focused investment.

items.title: PS Plus Extra Games for February 2026 Leak Online
items.summary: Trusted leaker Billbil-kun revealed three PS Plus Extra games for February 2026, with one being a major addition. Details emerged in recent gaming news digests.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Cisco Launches AI Networking Chip to Challenge Nvidia and Broadcom
items.summary: Cisco unveiled a new AI networking chip designed to speed data movement inside large AI clusters, positioning itself against entrenched players like Nvidia and Broadcom in the data-center networking space.

items.title: Microsoft Tests Superconducting Power Lines for Data Centers
items.summary: Microsoft is exploring high-temperature superconducting power cables for data centers to deliver electricity with a smaller physical footprint, addressing bottlenecks in grid infrastructure as data centers scale faster than power grids can be upgraded.

items.title: IBM Unveils Two New Quantum Supercomputers
items.summary: IBM announced two new quantum supercomputers as quantum technology transitions from experimental breakthroughs to practical applications, with Denmark also planning to develop a powerful commercial quantum computer.

items.title: Tech Stocks Decline Amid AI Investment Concerns
items.summary: Tech stocks led US markets lower as investors express concerns that massive AI investments by major technology companies may not generate returns in the near term.
